title: No puedo añadir motores de búsqueda y no se el motivo
content:
Buenos días,

Llevo usando Firefox hace más de 10 años, y durante este tiempo tuve una época en la que usaba dos motores de búsqueda que me resultaban a mi muy útiles, de dos páginas diferentes.

El caso es que a día de hoy, quisiera volver a utilizarlos esos mismos motores y no veo la manera de añadirlos a Firefox. Para que no haya dudas explico que ambas webs (las que quiero añadir su motor de búsqueda) siguen existiendo y funcionando en la actualidad, y son:

  • Filmaffinty
  • HD-Spain (Requiere inicio de sesión con usuario y contraseña, pero ésto no fue un impedimento cuando pude añadir su motor de búsqueda hace años a Firefox funcionando la web exactamente como hoy, con usuario y contraseña)

Hoy quisiera añadir nuevamente esos dos motores de búsqueda y me ocurre que:

1) El primer caso (Filmaffinity) no aparece la lupa con el signo "+" en verde, lo cual es incomprensible pues Filmaffinity es un motor de búsqueda ampliamente reconocido. En el pasado pude añadirlo sin problemas y hoy quisiera volverlo a hacer.

2) En el segundo caso (HD-Spain) sí me sale la lupa con el signo "+" en verde, pero sin embargo al añadir dicho motor de búsqueda me sale un cuadro de error y no se el motivo. Repito que no es problema de usuario y contraseña, ya que eso en el pasado no me impedió añadirlo y funcionar siempre correctamente, peor a día de hoy no me deja añadirlo.

Dejo dos capturas de ambos problemas, donde se ve lo que he indicado. No lo entiendo, tampoco entendería que fuese un problema inherente a Firefox porque sería como un enorme paso atrás en cuanto a la funcionalidad del navegador.

Me quedo a la espera a ver de cómo puedo solucionarlo, ya que ambos motores EXISTEN (evidentemente, pues funcionan dentro de las respetivas páginas cuando quieres buscar algo), así que debe de haber una solución para añadirlos a Firefox correctamente como cualquier otro motor de búsqueda de cualquier página web.

Gracias y un saludo.
creator: Mozillero444

'bold text'bold text '''''''I routinely keep 2 browsers open on my desktop; Chrome and Firefox. I use them for different things but my default browser is Firefox and I use Firefox for Microsoft Outlook 365 on the web.

For quite some time now, I have been having HUGE problems with delays in Firefox using Outlook when typing. Is there a solution for this? My computer expert tells me that Microsoft only tests and optimizes their websites for browsers using the Blink rendering engine, which includes Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Apple Safari, and Opera. Firefox uses a different engine. '

If this is true, then sadly I will need to change my default browser to Chrome which makes me sad since I believe Firefox is a better and more secure browser.''''

title: "The web site (XXX) does not support encryption for the page you are viewing" - but it does
content:
I was just examining the PageInfo area in Firefox for our Remote Desktop gateway. When I first click on the padlock, it says in green 'You are securely connected to this site'. However, when I click 'More information', under the 'Security' tab>Technical Details, it says 'The web site (our site) does not support encryption for the page you are viewing'.

This seems strange - Firefox is happy with the SSL cert - everything green. The site has an HTTPS address, and HTTP is disabled. By virtue of it being an HTTPS connection, it's encrypted, SSL cert or not. If the cert was bad, and I clicked to proceed anyway, it would still be encrypted - that's what HTTPS does.

So what doesn't Firefox like about the page? Any thoughts most welcome.

Thanks.

PS neither Chrome nor Edge flag up anything similar, in their equivocal areas.

title: 308046B0AF4A39CB - Firefox ESR 64 Bit - Installs.ini
content:
Does anybody know where the ID: 308046B0AF4A39CB comes from?

If you use a Windows 10 1909 64 Bit and you can find this in the installs.ini and in the profiles.ini of users, if you have a Firefox ESR 64 Bit in Version 78.10.0 installed. The INI-Files looks like this:

Installs.ini: [308046B0AF4A39CB] Default=Profiles/8U9skky2.default-esr Locked=1

Profiles.ini: [Install308046B0AF4A39CB] Default=Profiles/8U9skky2.default-esr Locked=1

[Profile0] Name=default-esr IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/8U9skky2.default-esr

[General] StartWithLastProfile=0 Version=2

This ID can vary if you have a 32 bit ESR-installation as well and the only place I could find it is in the registry

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Mozilla\Firefox\TaskBarIDs] C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox=308046B0AF4A39CB

But also here it differs sometimes.

I need to know where the ID comes from and if I can rely that if this ID is used, I will always address the Firefox ESR 64 Bit no matter which version.

title: Right click menu changes in FF 88 - can the right click menu be customized?
content:
There were significant changes to the right-click menu from Firefox 87 to Firefox 88. See the screen shots below for the FF 87 vs 88 menus.

Is there a way to restore or customize the right-click menu options? I want to change "Copy Link" back to "Copy Link Location" and for the "a" in "Location" to be underlined. For many years, possibly decades, I have been using right click and then tapping the "A" key to load the URL part of a link into the copy/paste buffer. With FF 88 this is now the "L" key which is painful as my right hand is on the mouse and my left hand is on the left side of the keyboard. Hitting "A" is a no-look-no-brainer for me. For "L" it looks like I need to remove my left hand from the mouse, look at the keyboard, and then tap it.

Related to this is that FF 88 removes "View Image Information" from right clicking on images. I also have used this regularly.
creator: mkupper

title: Firefox Developer Edition 89 b1 & b2 broken on macOS 11.3 RC
content: My Firefox Dev Edition just updated to 89 b1 today. The screen was blank, the new tab button and no buttons are working. None of the menu items work except the About Firefox which just keeps showing the Restart To Update button. If I click it, it just loads the same blank page again and same issue. I uninstalled and downloaded b2 from the website and still same exact issues. I'm running macOS 11.3 RC which was released today.
creator: abielert83
